reviewText:
I can forgive the delay in jumping.

What I can't forgive is the way this game handles dying.

Any fall off a platform goes into an animation that plays once and then just sits there. You then have to use your mouse to goto the top left corner and click the restart button, to reload the entire level. I tried mashing every button on my keyboard, but I could not find a keyboard command (like R" in most flash games that do this.)

That being said
date: I really enjoy the main mechanic of this game. With a bit more polish
recommended: this could be a nice little gem."

reviewText:
Its a really nice puzzle game, that is easy to get into and encourages you to stick with it. Its a 2.5d platformer, in which a character has to navigate a bunch of platforms, collecting 3 orbs on the way to escape on a final teleporting like platform. Puzzles / maps get progressively more difficult and interesting. The nice thing about this game is the rotation of the environment, and the way you do it. Its kind of counter intuitive, so you need to get used to it. But ultimately its a speed through the puzzle kind of thing.

I've just completed the first 10 maps (i believe there are 99 in total) in a little over an hour, so far, and am really enjoying it. After finishing the first 10 maps, the atmosphere has changed from fields to mountains, there are also additional complexity and additional tools to navigate the maps.

Needless to say it screams for Achievements and a leaderboard so you can compete with your friend for the best times through each of the maps. Most of the navigation involves rotating, walking and jumping. Unlike the other review here, i see no significant lag, or problems with jumping or any of the game mechanics, nor can i see how its relavent, as much of the time its just rotation of the environment, and dropping / falling with a bit of jumping.

Suggestions, achievements, and controller support as well. All in all nicely priced, original game, go buy it .. you wont be disapointed.

reviewText:
oh wow oh wow! congratulations evil sinner dev! you have set the all-time record for longest delayed jumps after pressing the jump button.  here is a list of things i actually did in the time i had between pressing the button and seeing my character jump on the screen

1. pick my nose (at least get my finger into my nose)

2. tap my girlfriend on the head while she was sitting behind me (yes the same girlfriend that won't let me watch star trek)

3. realize there was no way in hell i was going to actually try to play this game with the jump delay being what it is

so that is it. i have no interest in even trying to play. there is no way that the game won't suck with jumping being as horrible as it is now. it is literally the worst delay i've ever seen in my life, and it is not even close.

now that i've got that out of the way, let me just say the following: hello everybody its me woodlandfaerietruck!  the bundle stork came down from heaven with the worst game i've seen in a while. i think overall i am going to rate this game a negative 6.5 stars on the scale of badness. no robots or animals should ever be allowed to play, but humans are recommended to download this one just to see how badly the jumping ended up. only buy this if it is $.30USD american dollars or less, assuming they add steam trading cards.

reviewText: 2.5/10.\n\nTerrible platformer. Jumping is awkward and delayed. Graphics stink. Level design is bad and confusing. If you fall off, which you will constantly, must restart entire level, and not even easily. Need to use mouse to go to top left to click button. The switching ability sucks too. Not easy at all to use. You have to go to complete edge, then press down button. This means you will accidentally overrun and die. There is no grabbing of ledges for some reason. No controller support. For some reason you die if you flip and fall more than a small amount, even if there is something there to land on. Level design makes no sense. I got to end point but it wasn't activated, but had no idea why not. So I am left wandering around confusing level with no flow. Just don't play this.
